headline: Dow Jones Futures: AI Fears Grip Market; Arista, Applied Materials Jump On Earnings Late
summary: The stock market tumbled Thursday, with the S&P 500 below its 50-day line. The AI disruption trade is intensifying. Applied Materials and Arista Networks reported late.

headline: How McDonald's Strong 2025 Earnings and Digital Push Could Shape McDonald's (MCD) Investors
summary: In the fourth quarter and full year 2025, McDonald's reported higher revenue and net income versus 2024, with US$7,009 million in quarterly revenue, US$2,164 million in quarterly net income, and diluted EPS from continuing operations rising to US$3.03 for the quarter and US$11.95 for the year. Alongside these results, McDonald's reinforced its long-term plans by electing Ford CEO Jim Farley to its Board, affirming a US$1.86 quarterly dividend, and leaning into value-led promotions and viral...

content.title: How McDonald's Strong 2025 Earnings and Digital Push Could Shape McDonald's (MCD) Investors
content.summary: In the fourth quarter and full year 2025, McDonald's reported higher revenue and net income versus 2024, with US$7,009 million in quarterly revenue, US$2,164 million in quarterly net income, and diluted EPS from continuing operations rising to US$3.03 for the quarter and US$11.95 for the year. Alongside these results, McDonald's reinforced its long-term plans by electing Ford CEO Jim Farley to its Board, affirming a US$1.86 quarterly dividend, and leaning into value-led promotions and viral...

headline: Asia shares lower after sharp Wall Street losses on AI-related worries
summary: Asia shares were trading lower Friday, tracking sharp Wall Street losses on a sell-off of technology-related stocks that investors fear could lose out from artificial intelligence disruptions.  “Our sense remains that a sustained reversal of tech outperformance would require a big slide in tech itself,” Thomas Mathews, head of markets for Asia Pacific at Capital Economics wrote in a recent note.

content.title: Asia shares lower after sharp Wall Street losses on AI-related worries
content.summary: Asia shares were trading lower Friday, tracking sharp Wall Street losses on a sell-off of technology-related stocks that investors fear could lose out from artificial intelligence disruptions.  “Our sense remains that a sustained reversal of tech outperformance would require a big slide in tech itself,” Thomas Mathews, head of markets for Asia Pacific at Capital Economics wrote in a recent note.

headline: World shares mixed after sharp Wall Street losses on AI-related worries
summary: World shares were mixed on Friday, following sharp Wall Street losses on a sell-off of technology-related stocks that investors fear could lose out from artificial intelligence disruptions.  The S&P 500 fell for its second-worst day since Thanksgiving, dropping 1.6%, or 108.71, to 6,832.76, but it's still near an all-time high that was set last month.

content.title: World shares mixed after sharp Wall Street losses on AI-related worries

headline: Arcos Dorados Issues a Clarification on Expected Q1 2026 Performance
summary: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, February 13, 2026--Arcos Dorados Holdings Inc. (NYSE: ARCO) ("Arcos Dorados" or the "Company"), Latin America’s largest restaurant chain and the world’s largest independent McDonald’s franchisee, today issued a clarification with respect to its expected first quarter performance.

headline: Top food executives see the rise of value-seeking consumers
summary: Consumer prices rose less than expected in January, according to last month's Consumer Price Index (CPI) report, signaling a potential slowing in broader inflation trends. Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman takes a look back at what CEOs and other top executives from PepsiCo (PEP), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), Brinker International (EAT), and McDonald's (MCD) have to say about the state of the US consumer. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.description:

headline: After Q4 Earnings Beat, Is Wendy’s (WEN) a Value Opportunity or a Value Trap?
summary: Wendy’s (NASDAQ: WEN) delivered a mixed fourth quarter as the fast-food chain navigates mounting cost pressures and accelerating traffic declines. The company reported revenue of $543.0 million, narrowly topping the $541.3 million consensus estimate, while adjusted earnings per share of $0.16 beat expectations of $0.15. But beneath the headline beat lies a troubling reality: U.S. ... After Q4 Earnings Beat, Is Wendy’s (WEN) a Value Opportunity or a Value Trap?

headline: McDonald’s is adding energy drinks, craft sodas to McCafe line
summary: The beverages, inspired by the chain’s defunct CosMc’s spinoff, were “highly successful” in a 500-store test and will be deployed nationwide this year.

content.title: McDonald’s is adding energy drinks, craft sodas to McCafe line
content.summary: The beverages, inspired by the chain’s defunct CosMc’s spinoff, were “highly successful” in a 500-store test and will be deployed nationwide this year.

thumbnail.caption: McDonald's will test a new slate of premium drinks at 500 stores, including the five beverages pictured above.

headline: Restaurants Confront a High Beef-Price Headache
summary: High ground-beef prices have hurt restaurants, particularly burger chains that rely on meat for the bulk of their menus.  “We’ve have unprecedented high levels of beef inflation,” Shake Shack Chief Executive Rob Lynch said in an interview.  The fast-casual burger chain is working with its suppliers to help mitigate some of those costs, but still expects elevated beef prices to pinch this year.

content.title: Restaurants Confront a High Beef-Price Headache
content.summary: High ground-beef prices have hurt restaurants, particularly burger chains that rely on meat for the bulk of their menus.  “We’ve have unprecedented high levels of beef inflation,” Shake Shack Chief Executive Rob Lynch said in an interview.  The fast-casual burger chain is working with its suppliers to help mitigate some of those costs, but still expects elevated beef prices to pinch this year.
